Looks like you are new!\nTo start your journey fill in some data by clicking on the gear icon.\nThen you will be able to generate your graph, simply tap the arrow icon!

This operation is irreversible. You will loose everything tied to your WebSight account (Magnifiers, Graphs). We will completely remove you from our database if you validate the deletion with your password.

What is personal data?

Personal data is any piece of information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person, i.e. any individual person. For instance names, addresses, telephone numbers or even login and password details may be regarded as personal data.

Do I have privacy rights?

Privacy and data protection principles have been adopted by a large number of countries around the globe. Principles relating to the protection of your privacy and personal data are very often enforceable and, even in countries where there is no specific laws to that effect, you should always try to exercise these four basic rights: the rights to access, to rectify and update, to have data erased and to oppose to the processing of your data.

Exercise of these rights may be subject to certain restrictions or conditions locally.

What’s the right to be forgotten?

\n\n\t

The so-called “right to be forgotten” is a right which essentially applies under European law and which is a way of designating the right to have data erased. Certain conditions apply to the exercise of this right. Very often, the “right to be forgotten” is associated with the obligation which is imposed on search engines to allow, under specific rules and in accordance with a ruling by the European Court of Justice (13 May 2014), individuals to request the removal of certain search results associated with them (“dereferencing”).

How do I exercise my rights?

To exercise your rights you need to identify the entity which processes your personal data (e.g. the website where your information can be found, your mobile phone operator or a search engine) and send an appropriate request with adequate information. In general, you will need to provide information regarding: your identity (to prove you are who you say you are). In addition, depending on the nature of your request (access, rectify and update, erase, dereference), you will also need to provide additional information such as the link or address where the data relating to you can be found, the new updated information which should be used, the reason why you believe the information should be erased, etc.

If you want further aid in that regard, please click the button below and we will send you an email containing various models of correspondences you can send to exercise your rights.
An email has been sent to your account email address!
